content.1: He that dasheth in pieces is come up before thy face: keep the munition, watch the way, make
content.3: The shield of his mighty men is made red, the valiant men
content.4: The chariots shall rage in the streets, they shall justle one against another in the broad ways: they shall seem like torches, they shall run like the lightnings.
content.5: He shall recount his worthies: they shall stumble in their walk; they shall make haste to the wall thereof, and the defence shall be prepared.
content.6: The gates of the rivers shall be opened, and the palace shall be dissolved.
content.7: And Huzzab shall be led away captive, she shall be brought up, and her maids shall lead
content.9: Take ye the spoil of silver, take the spoil of gold: for
content.10: She is empty, and void, and waste: and the heart melteth, and the knees smite together, and much pain
content.12: The lion did tear in pieces enough for his whelps, and strangled for his lionesses, and filled his holes with prey, and his dens with ravin.
